title: Showers expected in parts of the island
byline: Showers will occur at times in the Western, Sabaragamuwa and Central provinces and in Galle and Matara districts, the Department of Meteorology said.

title: Govt. will extend its support to strengthen manufacturing industry, says President Dissanayake
byline: A pre-budget discussion for the year 2026 was held on Wednesday (27) at the Presidential Secretariat under the patronage of President Anura Kumara Dissanayake with local entrepreneurs in the ceramic industry, to review concerns and proposals related to challenges in the industry.

title: Shooter kills two Minneapolis school children in Catholic church, wounds 17 others
byline: An assailant armed with three guns fired through stained-glass windows into a Catholic church where parish school students were attending Mass on Wednesday, killing two children and wounding 17 other people, officials said.

title: ‘Kehelbaddara Padme’ and ‘Commando Salinda’ among 6 underworld figures arrested in Indonesia
byline: A total of six Sri Lankan underworld figures, including ‘Kehelbaddara Padme’ and ‘Commando Salinda’, have been arrested in Jakarta, Indonesia, Police Media Spokesperson ASP F.U. Wootler said.

title: Trump administration moves to tighten duration of visas for students and media
byline: The Trump administration aims to tighten the duration of visas for students, cultural exchange visitors and members of the media, according to a proposed government regulation issued on Wednesday, part of a broader crackdown on legal immigration.

title: More details revealed on shooting incident in Panadura
byline: Sri Lanka Police have revealed more information regarding the shooting incident in the Alubogahawatte area in Wanduramulla, Panadura, that killed one person last night.

title: Election for vacant Anunayake position of Asgiri Chapter to be held today
byline: The election to fill the vacant position of Anunayake of the Asgiri Chapter will be held today (August 28) at 2.00 PM at the historic ‘Pohoyage’ of the Asgiri Maha Viharaya in Kandy.

title: SLTB trade unions launch strike over several demands
byline: Several trade unions of the Sri Lanka Transport Board (SLTB) commenced trade union action from midnight yesterday (27) based on four demands.

title: Suspect arrested for injuring police officer during protest near Colombo Fort Magistrate’s Court
byline: A suspect has been arrested for injuring a police officer during a protest near the Colombo Fort Magistrate’s Court on August 26.

title: One person killed in shooting in Panadura
byline: A person has been killed in a shooting incident in the Alubogahawatte area in Wanduramulla, Panadura.

title: Putin, Kim Jong Un to attend Chinese parade in show of defiance to the West
byline: Russian President Vladimir Putin and North Korea’s Kim Jong Un will attend a military parade in Beijing, marking the first public appearance of the two leaders alongside President Xi Jinping in a show of collective defiance amid Western pressure.

title: A special court to try organized criminals - Public Security Minister
byline: The Sri Lankan government has decided to establish a special court to try organized criminals and expedite the cases against them, says Minister of Public Security Ananda Wijepala.

title: ‘No one is above the law’: Govt committed to ensure everyone is held accountable - Public Security Minister
byline: Minister of Public Security Ananda Wijepala revealed that the major Sri Lankan underworld figures, including ‘Kehelbaddara Padme’ and ‘Commando Salinda,’ who were arrested in Jakarta, Indonesia, will be repatriated to the country within the next two to three days.

title: Historic operation in Indonesia led to arrest of 5 major Sri Lankan underworld figures at once - IGP
byline: The arrest of five of Sri Lanka’s most infamous underworld figures in Indonesia at once marks the first time in history that such an operation has been carried out, says Inspector General of Police (IGP) Priyantha Weerasooriya.

title: Nvidia CEO says AI boom far from over
byline: Nvidia CEO Jensen Huang on Wednesday dismissed concern about an end to a spending boom on artificial intelligence chips, projecting opportunities will expand into a multi-trillion-dollar market over the next five years.

title: Details of major underworld figures arrested in Indonesia during joint operation revealed
byline: Six individuals including five members of Sri Lanka’s top underworld figures and a woman have been arrested in a joint operation conducted by a special Sri Lankan Criminal Investigation Department (CID) team and the Indonesian Police in Jakarta, Indonesia.

title: Former NLB Director Thusitha Halloluwa further remanded
byline: Former Executive Director of the National Lotteries Board, Thusitha Halloluwa, has been further remanded until September 4 by the Colombo Magistrate’s Court, said Ada Derana reporter.

title: Second round of review of new Anti-Terrorism Bill underway
byline: President’s Counsel Rienzie Arsekularatne, the Chairman of the expert committee appointed under Cabinet approval to draft the new Anti-Terrorism Bill stated that the committee’s work will be completed within the month of September.

title: India faces first legal challenge against online money games ban
byline: An Indian gaming company has challenged the government’s ban on online money-based games, a legal filing shows, in the first case against a law that led to the sudden shutdown of popular contests and has thrown the industry’s future into doubt.

title: ‘National Research Priorities Report’ handed over to President’s Secretary
byline: The Research Priorities for Sri Lanka – 2026 report, aligned with the Government’s socio-economic development programme, has been officially presented to the Secretary to the President Dr Nandika Sanath Kumanayake at the Presidential Secretariat today.

title: Ex-President Ranil still in ICU, no decision on date of discharge
byline: Former President Ranil Wickremesinghe, who was arrested on charges of misappropriation of state funds and later released on bail, is still receiving treatment at the Intensive Care Unit of the Colombo National Hospital.

title: Colombo HC issues notices to hear Rajitha’s revision petition
byline: The Colombo High Court today (28) issued a notice to consider the revision petition filed by former Minister Rajitha Senaratne, seeking an order to suspend the arrest warrant issued by the Colombo Magistrate’s Court to take him into custody.

title: Japanese town proposes two-hour daily limit on smartphones
byline: A central Japanese town wants to limit smartphone use for all its 69,000 residents to two hours a day, in a move that has sparked intense debate on device addiction.

title: Tragic school van accident: Tipper truck driver remanded
byline: The driver of the tipper truck, which collided head-on with a school van in the Kuliyapitiya area on August 27, killing three persons including two schoolgirls, has been remanded after being produced before court.

title: Teacher recruitment exam once SC concludes hearing of four cases: PM
byline: The legal proceedings of four cases under review by the Supreme Court, which have been the primary reason for the delay in recruiting unemployed graduates as teachers are now reaching their final stage, according to Prime Minister Dr Harini Amarasuriya.

title: SLAF warns against kite flying near airports
byline: The Sri Lanka Air Force (SLAF) has warned the public regarding the potential dangers to aircraft operations associated with kite flying, which is a popular activity in the country these days.

title: CEB Engineers’ Union opposes letters issued to employees without VRS offer
byline: The Ceylon Electricity Board Engineers’ Union has raised concerned about the purported assignation letters issued to employees of the CEB claiming to be under and in terms of the Sri Lanka Electricity Act.

title: Schoolgirl and lorry assistant killed in road accident in Kahatagasdigiliya
byline: A schoolgirl and a lorry assistant have died in a road accident that occurred this afternoon in Alayapattuwa along the Horowpothana –Kahatagasdigiliya main road.

title: UK, France and Germany move to reimpose UN sanctions on Iran
byline: The UK, France and Germany have begun the process of restoring major UN sanctions on Iran - lifted under a 2015 deal - as tensions once again escalate over Iran’s nuclear programme.

title: Man arrested for assaulting police officer during protest near Fort Magistrate’s Court remanded
byline: An individual, who was arrested for allegedly assaulting a police officer on duty with a water bottle adjacent to the Colombo Fort Magistrate’s Court on Tuesday, has been remanded, said Ada Derana reporter.

title: Man held at BIA with mobile phones and cardamom worth Rs. 20M
byline: An individual has been arrested at the Bandaranaike International Airport while attempting to smuggle a consignment of mobile phones and cardamom worth approximately Rs. 20 million into the country.

title: 646 individuals arrested during special island-wide police raids
byline: A total of 646 individuals have been arrested on suspicion of being involved in criminal activities and also over illicit liquor and drug-related offenses during a special island-wide operation conducted yesterday.

title: Floods affect 1.2 million, displace nearly 250,000 in eastern Pakistan
byline: Rescuers in boats raced to reach stranded families in Pakistan’s populous eastern Punjab province on Thursday, after three major rivers burst their banks because of heavy rain and the release of water from overflowing dams in neighbouring India.

title: Vehicular movement restricted along Colombo - Kandy main road in Warakapola
byline: Vehicular movement along the Colombo –Kandy will be restricted due to the Deva Perahera held at the ancient Sri Pattini Devalaya in Rangala Cave, Ambepussa, Warakapola.

title: Ven. Narampanawa Ananda Thero elected as Anunayake of the Asgiri Chapter
byline: Venerable Narampanawa Ananda Thero has been elected as the Anunayake of the Asgiri Chapter.

title: Argentina hunts allegedly Nazi-looted painting spotted in ad
byline: Authorities in Argentina are searching for an 18th-century Italian portrait believed to have been looted by a fugitive Nazi officer 80 years ago.

title: Japan’s trade negotiator cancels US visit over tariff deal snag
byline: Japan’s top trade negotiator cancelled a visit to the United States at the last minute on Thursday, further delaying talks designed to finalise a $550 billion investment package offered by Tokyo in exchange for relief on punishing tariffs.

title: New details emerge on arrest of five underworld figures including  Kehelbaddara Padme’ in Indonesia
byline: New details have emerged regarding the arrest of five high-profile underworld figures, including Kehelbaddara Padme, who are linked to multiple murders—including the killing of Ganemulla Sanjeewa—and major drug trafficking operations.

title: Several arrested for killing pregnant spotted deer in Wilpattu National Park
byline: A total of five individuals have been arrested today by wildlife officers for allegedly shooting and killing a pregnant spotted deer within the Wilpattu National Park.
